titles.title: Migratory Bird Habitat Investment and Enhancement Act
Migratory Bird Habitat Investment and Enhancement Act
A bill to amend the prices set for Federal Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamps and make limited waivers of stamp requirements for certain users.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer with an amendment. With written report No. 113-210.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 466.

bill.summary:
7/15/2014--Reported to Senate amended. Migratory Bird Habitat Investment and Enhancement Act - Amends the Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act to allow the Department of the Interior every five years to set the cost for Federal Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamps, commonly known as Duck Stamps and required to hunt migratory waterfowl. Limits the cost of the stamp to $25 for the first five years and $30 after that.
Permits Interior to waive stamp requirements for certain individuals if it will have a minimal adverse effect on the funds collected.
